sense.name: Strip the skin off of a (formerly) living thing.
sense.commentary: Includes: PEEL OFF Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] PEEL NP2[patient] NP1[agent] PEEL OFF NP2[attribute] PP{P NP[patient]}
sense.examples: He peeled the apple before eating it. She peeled off every bit of the mango's skin to get rid of the pesticides. Workers peel off the skin from the pigs after scalding them; it's a horrific process.

sense.name: Come off it flakes or small pieces.
sense.commentary: Note: May be metaphorical. Includes: PEEL OFF. PEEL AWAY Syntax Is: NP1[patient] PEEL (PP{P NP[location]})
sense.examples: The paint in my house is peeling off. Sunburned skin peeled from her shoulders.

sense.name: (Cause to) reduce or diminish, possibly leaving an underlying structure in place.
sense.commentary: Includes: PEEL OFF, PEEL AWAY Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] PEEL NP2[patient[abstract]] NP1[patient[abstract]] PEEL
sense.examples: Rates haven't peeled off that much this past quarter. Layers of management will peel away, leaving autonomous regional offices. We're peeling away much of our corporate structure. Peel away the BS and he doesn't really have much to say.

sense.name: PEEL OFF: undress; remove clothing.
sense.examples: He peeled off his blood-soaked shirt. She peeled off her dress and slip and took a shower. You can't just peel off your clothing in public!

sense.name: Squeal the tires of a car while starting motion.
sense.examples: She took off running to a car that was waiting and they peeled out of the parking lot. He peeled off the median and sped away. Don't peel out - it wears away your tires.

sense.name: Remove one's attention or perception from.
sense.examples: Peel yourself away from the videogame for a second and listen to me! She couldn't peel her eyes away from the television. I can't seem to peel my attention from this task.

sense.name: PEEL ONE'S EYES (FOR): become or remain attentive.
sense.commentary: Is: PEEL ONE'S EYES (FOR) Note: Be really careful not to annotate adjectival uses.
sense.examples: Workers should peel their eyes for errors on the line. Peel your eyes, boys. The enemy is coming.
